properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 2:14PM EST until February 21 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...Winter Weather Advisory...

.High pressure extending from the Midwest into the mid-Atlantic
Region will direct a cold northerly flow into the forecast area
into this evening. Moisture flowing overtop of this cold air will
produce rainfall, which will then turn to a mixture of rain and
snow this evening across northern portions of the forecast area.
The precipitation will end from west to east late tonight, with
dry conditions on Friday..

* WHAT...Periods of rain mixed with snow, then possibly turning to
all snow late this evening, is expected. Total snow
accumulations mainly less than one inch. By Friday morning,
black ice will likely develop as temperatures fall to around
freezing by morning.

* WHERE...Chesterfield and Lancaster counties.

* WHEN...Until 9 AM EST Friday, with the greater impacts tonight
with the rain/snow mixture, and then early Friday morning
because wet roads and development of black ice.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute Friday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hazardous travel conditions are possible
mainly on bridges and overpasses because of black ice.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST FRIDAY
